description: Borrowed from Latin affixus, perfect passive participle of affigere (from ad- + figere), equivalent to ad- +‎ fix.

entries.meaning: That which is affixed; an appendage.
examples: Synonyms: addition, supplement; see also Thesaurus:adjunct

entries.meaning: (linguistic morphology) A bound morpheme added to the word’s stem's end.
(linguistic morphology, broadly) A bound morpheme added to a word’s stem; a prefix, suffix, etc.
examples: Hyponyms: prefix, suffix, infix, circumfix, suprafix

entries.meaning:
(mathematics) The complex number 
  
    
      
        a
        +
        b
        i
      
    
    {\displaystyle a+bi}
  
 associated with the point in the Gauss plane with coordinates 
  
    
      
        (
        a
        ,
        b
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle (a,b)}
  
.
(decorative art) Any small feature, as a figure, a flower, or the like, added for ornament to a vessel or other utensil, to an architectural feature.

verbs.description: affix (third-person singular simple present affixes, present participle affixing, simple past and past participle affixed)

examples: Synonyms: join, put together, unite; see also Thesaurus:join

entries.meaning: (transitive) To subjoin, annex, or add at the close or end; to append to.
examples: to affix a syllable to a word
to affix a seal to an instrument
to affix one's name to a writing

entries.meaning: (transitive) To fix or fasten figuratively; with on or upon.
